Low-beta stocks back in vogue as momentum bets disappoint

Low-beta stocks back in vogue as momentum bets disappoint
By & , ET BureauLast Updated: Apr 14, 2025, 05:49:00 AM IST

The uncertainty surrounding the global trade tariffs after the US slapped reciprocal tariffs on exporting countries earlier this month, the volatility index (VIX), which captures the expectations of market participants about near term volatility, across major equity markets shot up significantly.

ET Intelligence Group: Stocks that show lower fluctuations relative to the benchmark index, or the low beta stocks, are back on investors' radar as their focus shifts away from momentum stocks amid rising market volatility. ETIG has identified 258 such stocks, that have a beta ratio of 0.9 or lower among the BSE 500 firms. Moreover, 103, or 40%, of these stocks have been able to beat the Sensex return over a span of one year, and 60% have outpaced the index return over the past month.

The uncertainty surrounding the global trade tariffs after the US slapped reciprocal tariffs on exporting countries earlier this month, the volatility index (VIX), which captures the expectations of market participants about near term volatility, across major equity markets shot up significantly. The India VIX, which is calculated by using bid-ask quotes of Nifty option contracts, has increased by nearly 46% in a week to April 11, reflecting a sharp rise in market volatility.


While VIX captures the volatility at the broader market level, the beta factor denotes it for a specific stock. A beta of one indicates that the stock's volatility is the same as that of the market. A beta below one reflects stocks are less susceptible to market fluctuations. Rising market volatility also affects a stock's beta coefficient. For instance, the number of stocks that had a beta of either 0.9 or lower now stands at 258 in the BSE 500 index compared with 287 a year ago and 261 at the beginning of 2025.

The list compiled by ETIG is dominated by FMCG and retail stocks including HUL, ITC, Britannia, United Spirits, United Breweries, and healthcare stocks such as Sun Pharma, Torrent Pharma, Apollo Hospitals, and Glaxosmithkline Pharma. Companies from other varied sectors include Eicher Motors, Sun TV Network, Blue Dart Express, Coromandel International, and HDFC Life Insurance. Each of these firms have outperformed the Sensex in the one-month and one-year frames.
